answers.answer: My cholesterol levels sky-rocketed before I was dx'd with hypoT and Hashi's, also.  My doctor also insisted that I go on cholesterol med and I refused because it seems that once on those meds, they never want to let you come off them.Hypothyroidism can cause cholesterol levels to go high, but my triglycerides weren't as high as yours.  I think that has to be a decision YOU make based on how you feel.My cholesterol levels, including triglycerides all began coming down after a few months on synthroid.  I'm  now on both levothyroxine and cytomel and my cholesterol levels are all in the normal range......   BUT - just because it worked out that way for me, doesn't mean it will work that way for you.I also went through a stress test with flying colors, echocardiogram showed small leak in one valve but not to worry about at this point.  Cardiologist suggested that I try red yeast rice to keep cholesterol in line ---- pcp did NOT like that (of course, he wanted to Rx Crestor), but I went with the red yeast rice.  I take it only a couple of times a week.  Levels will be checked again in a couple of months.......I am also not diabetic; however, suspecting "pre-diabetes".  Good luck with whatever you decide.

question: I am 63 year old male, type 2 diabetic.  Recently diagnosed as hypothyroid.  Recent blood work shows A1C at 5.8, cholesterol within normal limits except for slightly low HDL.  Triglycerides 370.  Here's my question:I have learned by my own research that hypothyroid can cause high triglycerides.  Doc wants me to take synthroid (sp?) AND medicine to control triglycerides.Is it a feasible course of action to work on the thyroid normalization first, THEN add the triglyceride medication, or is beginning both a better way to go?  Seems that if the thyroid is taken care of there is a reasonable chance for the trig's to decrease.  I have *never* had trig's this high.Have also lately had PVC, which can possibly be due to hypothyroid, right?  Nuclear stress test is completely normal, except for the irregular beat.  No evidence of CAD.Is my position on medication feasible?
title: Hypothyroid and triglycerides
